definition: The indefinite article 'a' is used before words that begin with a consonant sound to introduce something non-specific or to mention something for the first time. It indicates a single, general item.
examples: She found a book on the table.
There is a cat in the garden.
I saw a movie last night.

definition: To abandon means to leave someone or something behind with no intention of returning or to stop supporting or looking after someone or something. Often, it involves leaving someone or something in a difficult situation.
examples: She had to abandon her car in the snow.
He felt abandoned when his friends left him alone.
The project was abandoned due to a lack of funds.

definition: The power, skill, or capability to do something. Ability is a person's natural or acquired talent or skill to accomplish tasks successfully.
examples: She has the ability to solve complex problems.
His ability to communicate made him a great leader.
They praised her ability to work under pressure.

definition: Having the power, skill, or means to do something; capable of doing something. Being able means possessing the qualities needed to accomplish something.
examples: She is able to solve the puzzle quickly.
He was able to lift the heavy box without assistance.
They are able to work independently.

definition: In reference to or concerning a particular subject. It is used to indicate what a discussion, book, or event is related to or focused on.
examples: She read a book about history.
He is curious about the new project.
We talked about the upcoming event.

definition: In a higher position than something else, either physically or in rank or level. It is often used to describe spatial relationships or levels of importance.
examples: The airplane flew above the clouds.
Her score was above average.
The temperature rose above 30 degrees Celsius.

definition: In or to a foreign country or countries. Often used to describe someone who is traveling or staying outside their home country for an extended period.
examples: She plans to study abroad next year.
They went abroad for their vacation.
Living abroad has broadened his perspective.

definition: Complete, total, or perfect; not limited by any restrictions or conditions. It often implies an extreme or unchanging quality or state.
examples: She has absolute trust in him.
It was an absolute success.
They were in absolute agreement on the issue.

definition: Without any doubt or qualification; completely or totally. It is often used to emphasize an opinion or statement.
examples: She is absolutely sure of her answer.
I absolutely love this place.
The movie was absolutely fantastic.

definition: Related to education, scholarship, and formal studies. It often describes things associated with schools, universities, or scholarly pursuits.
examples: She achieved high academic standards.
The academic year begins in September.
His academic career spanned over 30 years.
